title.narrative: EARLY CHILDHOOD DEVELOPMENT

description.narrative: By 2022, national institutions will have the capacity to improve access to, relevance and quality of integrated services for early childhood, especially for children with disabilities., which contributes to Early Childhood Development, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children will have access to high-quality, relevant, inclusive integrated care services for early childhood and education services.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, national institutions will have the capacity to improve access to, relevance and quality of integrated services for earlychildhood, especially for children with disabilities.

description.narrative: UNICEF advocated, and provided support for, the safe reopening of 100 percent of ECD services benefiting 207,000children and contributed to the strengthening of INAIPI’s capacities with the design and implementation of the Early Childhood Development Evaluation System pilot and the e-learning platform. Additionally, UNICEF provided technical support for the revision of the early childhood attention Bill, currently in the Senate.Health services for premature babies, newborns,;and children were strengthened through training obstetric and neonatal nurses, supporting the Kangaroo Mother Care programme, training pediatric HIV units’ personnel and, additionally, including the implementation of Care for Child Development approach. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:13/01/2022
